newsitem.title: USA: Chancellor, Evergreen to buy Katz.
newsitem.headline: Chancellor, Evergreen to buy Katz.

text.p: Evergreen Media Corp and Chancellor Broadcasting Co said Monday they have a definitive agreement to acquire Katz Media Group Inc for about $373 million.

Under the terms, Katz shareholders will receive $11 in cash for each share they hold. The transaction value is based on about 14.1 million Katz shares and the assumption of about $218 million of its debt.
Under the deal, Katz Media will ultimately be owned by Chancellor once the pending merger of Evergreen and Chancellor is completed.
Katz sells national spot advertising time for radio stations, television stations, cable systems and Internet sites throughout the United States.
For the 1996 fiscal year, it generated $183 million in revenue and earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization of $44.1 million.

The deal is expected to be completed in this year's third quarter. Katz is to retain its name, organizational identity, management team and personnel, as well as its New York headquarters and its 65 regional sales offices.
Terms of the agreement were approved by the boards of directors of all three companies.
